original_title: Sri Lanka Treasuries yields ease across maturities, all bills sold
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasuries yields eased across maturities at Wednesday’s auction with all offered 180 billion rupees of bills sold, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office accepted 90 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 19.78 percent, down by 0.12 basis points from a week earlier, after offering 90 billion rupees.
50 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 17.11 percent, down by 0.46 basis points from a week earlier after offering 50 billion rupees.
40 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 13.94 percent, down by 0.22 basis points from a week earlier after offering 40 billion. (Colombo/Aug10/2023)
